project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Internally Displaced Persons Economic Development Support Project is to help improve in Azerbaijan living conditions of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and enhance their economic opportunities and prospects for social integration. The project includes three components: (a) micro-projects; (b) micro-credits; and (c) implementation support. The micro-project component finance more than 150 small-scale projects for the: (a) repair and rehabilitation or construction and includes of basic infrastructure such as water supply networks, power supply, access roads, and drainage systems; (b) repair, rehabilitation or construction of social infrastructure such as schools and community centers; and (c) repair and rehabilitation of temporary shelter facilities. The Additional Financing would also allow the Social Fund for the Development of Internally Displaced Persons (SFDI) to fund its operating costs during the additional three years needed for the implementation of micro-project activities. The project will contribute to the achievement of a pillar of the Country Partnership Strategy (CPS): increasing the quality of and access to social services. This pillar has a direct focus on improving living conditions and economic opportunities of internally displaced persons.
